credit_line: Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund
dimensions: H x W (seamed in middle): 196 x 175 cm (6 ft. 5 3/16 in. x 5 ft. 8 7/8 in.)
title: Textile
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: plain weave foundation; starch paste applied by hand and immersion dyed in indigo (adire)
description: Checkerboard of rectangles, each filled with geometric patterns in shades of blue and white. The textile is composed of two widths of fabric stitched together in the center; the two pieces are identical in their patterning, but have been arranged in opposite orientations.
name: Textile
